benchmark_details.name: CHENGYU-BENCH
benchmark_details.overview: CHENGYU-BENCH is a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate large language models on their understanding and usage of Chinese idioms across three tasks: Evaluative Connotation, Appropriateness, and Open Cloze.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a rigorous testing ground for evaluating culturally-specific language understanding in large language models focused on Chinese idioms.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark focuses exclusively on canonical four-character chengyu and employs a binary polarity scheme.

data.source: Diverse high-quality texts from webpages, news articles, academic papers, and essays containing Chinese idioms.

methodology.calculation: Performance is measured based on the models' correct classifications and predictions on the benchmark tasks.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy indicates effective understanding and use of Chinese idioms; lower scores highlight challenges in contextual application.
methodology.validation: Evaluation of several leading large language models.
